questions.text: During an intra-oral procedure, the resident uses the given suture material to place sutures on the soft palate. What is this suture material called?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Plain catgut

The suture material shown in the image is plain catgut. It is a yellowish absorbable suture material.

questions.text: A patient who had undergone a retro-oesophagal goitre resection was found to have partial ptosis and loss of hemifacial sweating. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Horner’s syndrome
The given clinical scenario is suggestive of Horner’s syndrome. The cervical sympathetic trunk is at risk of injury in invasive thyroid cancers and retro-esophageal goitres and may result in Horner’s syndrome.

choices.text: Identified 5th intercostal space anterior to mid axillary line to place the tube
Inserted tube along the lower border of upper rib
Directed tube posteriorly to prevent injury

questions.text: An intern placed an intercostal drainage tube in a patient. Which of the following steps is incorrect?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Inserted tube along the lower border of upper rib

An intercostal tube (ICD) is placed along the upper border of the lower rib at the 5th intercostal space (ICS) to prevent damage to the neurovascular bundle. Hence, option B is Incorrect.

questions.text: Trauma and Injury Severity Score (TRISS) includes which of the following components?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

RTS + ISS + age
TRISS (Trauma and Injury Severity Score) includes:
•    Injury Severity Score (ISS)
•    Revised Trauma Score (RTS)
•    Age
•    Mechanism of injury (blunt/penetrating).

questions.text: A woman presented with a BIRADS-5 breast lesion. Which of the following is a good prognostic factor for this lesion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)
ER positive

ER positivity is a good prognostic factor in breast cancer.The ER and PR are two steroid hormone receptors present in breast cancer. The expression of these receptors indicates a favorable prognosis and response to hormonal therapy.

questions.text: A patient who was admitted after a road traffic accident is put on mechanical ventilation. He opens his eyes on verbal command and moves all four limbs spontaneously. Calculate his GCS.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Eyes-3, Verbal-NT, Motor-6
The patients GCS is Eyes-3, Verbal-NT, Motor-6.
It is calculated as follows:
Eye opening: Opening to verbal command – 3
Verbal response: In the case of endotracheal intubation, the verbal response score is noted as NT (non-testable)
Motor respone: Movement of all 4 limbs spontaneously – 6

questions.text: Which of the following suture techniques is employed for the best cosmetic appearance after wound healing?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Subcuticular sutures 

The suture technique employed for the best cosmetic appearance after wound healing is the subcuticular suturing technique.

choices.text: Should be done by continuous layers as it takes less time
Should be done by using single layer seromuscular Lambert sutures

questions.text: A 6-year-old-child was brought to the hospital with obstructed hernia. On exploration, bowel was found gangrenous. Which of the following is true about anastomosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


For bowel anastomosis, interrupted and continuous single-layer suture techniques are adequate and safe. So, preferred Answer for bowel anastomosis should be single layer taking submucosa.

questions.text: A truck driver undergoes a Limberg flap operation using a random flap for recurrent pilonidal sinus infections. What is the generally accepted safe and reliable length: width ratio for this type of flap?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1.5:1 

The Limberg flap is a type of random flap and the safe and reliable length:width ratio for the random flap is no more than 1.5:1.

questions.text: A 35-year-old male patient, who was diagnosed with a ventral hernia, is planned for mesh hernioplasty. The mesh is considered to be well placed if it covers all margins of the defect by a distance at least:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The mesh should cover all the margins of the defect by at least 20 mm (2 cm) for it to be considered as a well-placed mesh.

questions.text: A 65-year-old male patient presents with a direct inguinal hernia on the left side. He underwent open hernioplasty with mesh repair. Which of the following nerves is most likely to be injured?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ilioinguinal nerve
The ilioinguinal nerve is most commonly injured within open hernia repair due to traction or thermal injury. The ilioinguinal nerve provides innervation to the groin and medial aspect of the thigh, the upper part of the scrotum, and the penile root.

questions.text: A 15-year-old male patient presented to emergency with pain in the right lower quadrant. He was diagnosed with acute appendicitis. Which of the following is the most commonly used incision for appendectomy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Gridiron incision

The most commonly used incision for an appendectomy is McBurney’s Gridiron incision. The incision is made at McBurney’s point (two-thirds from the umbilicus to the anterior superior iliac spine). They involve passing through all of the abdominal muscles, transversalis fascia, and then the peritoneum, before entering the abdominal cavity.

questions.text: A male patient following an accident presented with complex injuries including degloving injuries of the foot and leg. What type of flap/graft was used during surgery?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Thiersch graft

The image given shows a Thiersch graft which is also known as a split-thickness skin graft.

questions.text: A patient with a history of recurrent pilonidal sinus underwent surgery as shown in the image. What kind of flap procedure is used here?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Rhomboid flap

The following image shows a rhomboid flap done in pilonidal sinus surgery. A pilonidal sinus is defined as a blind track lined by granulation tissue leading from an epithelial surface to surrounding tissue. Pilonidal sinus disease, also called jeep/driver’s bottom, is commonly seen in the natal cleft, more in men, usually after puberty

questions.text: A 20-year-old male presented to the trauma centre after suffering a road traffic accident. He is tachypneic with cold extremities. His BP on arrival is 90/50 mm Hg. Which of the following is true about the pathophysiology of his condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Increased vascular resistance
The above described patient with cold extremities, tachypnea and low blood pressure in a background of trauma has hypovolemic shock. In a patient with hypovolemic shock, there is increased systemic vascular resistance, decreased venous return(preload) and low mixed venous oxygen saturation.

questions.text: A 62-year-old female presented to the OPD with complaints of a gradually progressive swelling over his abdomen for 1.5 years. She had a history of midline surgery done as a child. On examination, the swelling was 4 cm and was reducible with a palpable cough impulse. She is planned to undergo fascial closure with a mesh repair. What is the likely location of the mesh as shown in image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Onlay

The above clinical scenario of a reducible swelling with cough impulse and palpable defect in a patient with a previous surgery points toward a diagnosis of incisional hernia. Incisional hernias are repaired by fascial closure augmented with a mesh. It is an onlay type of mesh repair.

questions.text: Identify the instrument given in the image below:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


The image given is of a Morris retractor, which is a large retractor useful for providing maximum exposure in large incisions e.g., abdominal incisions.

choices.text: The extent does not cross the wound margins
Wide excision of the keloid scar prevents recurrence
Histopathology of a keloid scar shows reduced collagen and increased vascularity
A keloid scar forms due to increase in the level of growth factors

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true with regards to a keloid scar?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


Keloid scars are associated with elevated levels of growth factor. A keloid scar is defined as excessive scar tissue that extends beyond the boundaries of the original incision or wound. Its etiology is unknown, but is associated with elevated levels of growth factor, deeply pigmented skin, and inherited tendency and certain areas of the body (triangle whose points are the xiphisternum and each shoulder tip). The histology of keloid scars shows excess collagen with hypervascularity, and there is more type 3 collagen.

questions.text: Which is the best graft for a femoropopliteal bypass?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


The great saphenous vein is the best as it lasts longer than polytetrafluoroethylene, dacron and human umbilical vein as a graft in a femoropopliteal bypass.

questions.text: A 55-year-old male with a known history of diabetes came with a wound on his foot. Identify the given condition.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


The given picture showing an ulcer with  punched-out edges over a pressure point is most likely that of a trophic ulcer/ neuropathic ulcer.
